csharp.shortDescription: Primary .NET language used for Windows apps and game development
longDescription: C# is a modern, object-oriented language developed by Microsoft, widely used in enterprise backends, desktop applications, and via Unity in game development.
It features strong typing, garbage collection, LINQ, async/await, and a rich ecosystem.

javascript.shortDescription: High-level, interpreted language mainly for web development
longDescription: JavaScript is the lingua franca of the web, powering interactive pages in browsers and with Node.js on servers.
It supports event-driven, functional, and imperative styles, and has vast ecosystems (React, Vue, Angular, Express, etc.).
learnWith: React  -  used on the frontend (front end is what the client sees)
Node.js  -  used on the backend (back end is what the server does)
TypeScript  -  super-set of JavaScript with static typing
